item.title: Ticket #1797 (Function needed for image handling) updated
item.dc:creator: skeltoac

item.title: Ticket #1797 (Function needed for image handling) created
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description: wp_shrink_dimensions gives core and plugins a routine for getting a proportionate set of smaller dimensions, as for creating thumbnails or constraining display.

item.title: Ticket #1787 (Subcategories with same name not addressable) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Putting the full path in the nicename requires quite a lot of changes, so we'll just go with the original patch.

item.title: Ticket #1791 (Version the DB) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
fixed:

(In [2966]) DB versioning. fixes #1791

item.title: Changeset [2966]: DB versioning. fixes #1791
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: DB versioning. fixes #1791

item.title: Ticket #1795 (404 on preview of future dated posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: I think we should show it only in a preview context, and we should show it to any who has edit capabilities for that post.

item.title: Ticket #1796 (Session Saver inserts date in Write Post password field) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: As reported by Lorelle, and reproduceable: when Firefox is closed the Session Saver plugin records the tabs that were open and opens them again when Firefox is restarted. Unfortuantely, if the Write Post screen is loaded, it inserts the date in the password field. Not sure how we can fix this, but having value="" in the password input tag might fix it.

item.title: Ticket #1795 (404 on preview of future dated posts) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description: Future dated posts won't preview in the "Write Post" preview window. Maybe we need to make a change so that the post author can see a post, regardless of what date it's to be published on?

item.title: Ticket #1794 (Error message editing files from admin page if blog address different ...) created
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description: If your blog address is set to a different directory than the one WordPress is actually in (e.g. www.example.com/blog instead of just www.example.com), then you get the following error message at Manage > Files: "Oops, no such file exists! Double check the name and try again, merci."

item.title: Ticket #1388 (Private posts appearing in RSS2 feed - even when logged out) updated
item.dc:creator: seth
item.description:
Severity changed

This seems like it should be amazingly high-priority. I'm syndicated on a Planet Planet, and my private posts show up when posted!

item.title: Ticket #1793 (double quotes escaped inside pre tags) created
item.dc:creator: justinsomnia
item.description:
When you put a double quote (") inside a <pre> tag, it's published in an escaped fashion: (\")

Testcase: 

<pre>
"hello"
</pre>

Renders as: 

\"hello\"

Should be: 

"hello"

The workaround involves encoding double quotes as "

item.title: Ticket #1792 (3 slash missing in HTML when photo is drag and dropped to wysiwyg editor) created
item.dc:creator: carnaticwm
item.description:
Greetings,

am using latest svn version

I drag and drop a photo to the wysiwyg editor and check the HTML

3 slashes are missing in the url and the code looks like follows ! 

<a title="Feet Sensor Points" href="http://www.kishore.orgblog/?subpost_id=137">
 		<img width="76" height="96" alt="Feet Sensor Points"
src="http://www.kishore.orgblog/wp-content/uploads/2005/10/thumb-image001-foot.jpg"
/></a><a title="Feet Sensor Points"
href="http://www.kishore.orgblog/?subpost_id=137"> 	</a>

Cheers, Kishore.

item.title: Ticket #1791 (Version the DB) created
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Add a DB version and persist it in the DB. Check the version when upgrading so that we only do the work that is necessary for a given version delta. The DB version can be the repository revision number for the release. That way we have nice strictly incrementing ints to compare.

item.title: Ticket #1682 (Patch for wp_login_head Action in wp-login.php) updated
item.dc:creator: technosailor
item.description: It's not simply admin if users are moved through it to login and on logoff, redirected to it. I agree that it should be added.
